title: How to Print Multiple Images on One Page on PC or Mac

steps.headline: Open the folder that contains the photos you wish to print.
Select the photos you want to print.
steps.description: To select multiple photos, hold the Ctrl key as you click each file. You can also click and drag your mouse over the photos.

steps.headline: Right-click on the selected photos.
steps.description: This opens up a contextual menu.

steps.headline: Click Print on the menu.
steps.description: This opens up a print preview screen that shows you the images you chose to print.

steps.headline: Click the Contact Sheet option.
steps.description:
It's on the right side of the window, and you may have to scroll down to find it. This options can print up to 35 photos to a single page. If you don't like how it looks in the preview, try one of the other options:

Wallet allows you to fit up to nine images on a single piece of paper. If you're just printing two images, you can choose to print them to a single page at 4 x 6 inches or 5 x 7 inches. If you're printing four images, you can choose the 3.5 x 5 inch option.

steps.headline: Click Print.
steps.description: Your selected photos are printed onto a single piece of paper. You may have to select your printer's name from the "Printer" drop-down menu first.

steps.headline: Open the folder containing the photos you wish to print.
Select the photos you want to print.
steps.description: To select multiple photos, hold the ⌘ Command key while clicking each photo. You can also click and drag your mouse over the photos.

steps.headline: Click the File menu.
steps.description: This option is in the upper left corner of the window.

steps.headline: Click Print.
steps.description: This option appears in the drop-down menu after you click File. This opens up a print preview screen that shows you the images you chose to print.

steps.headline: Click the Contact Sheet option.
steps.description: It's on the right side of the print menu.

steps.headline: Click Print.
steps.description: Your selected photos are printed onto a single piece of paper. You may have to select your printer's name from the "Printer" drop-down menu first.

text:
Using Windows Open the folder that contains the photos you wish to print.  Select the photos you want to print. To select multiple photos, hold the Ctrl key as you click each file. You can also click and drag your mouse over the photos. Right-click on the selected photos. This opens up a contextual menu. Click Print on the menu. This opens up a print preview screen that shows you the images you chose to print. Click the Contact Sheet option. It's on the right side of the window, and you may have to scroll down to find it. This options can print up to 35 photos to a single page. If you don't like how it looks in the preview, try one of the other options:

Wallet allows you to fit up to nine images on a single piece of paper. If you're just printing two images, you can choose to print them to a single page at 4 x 6 inches or 5 x 7 inches. If you're printing four images, you can choose the 3.5 x 5 inch option. Click Print. Your selected photos are printed onto a single piece of paper. You may have to select your printer's name from the "Printer" drop-down menu first. Using macOS Open the folder containing the photos you wish to print.  Select the photos you want to print. To select multiple photos, hold the ⌘ Command key while clicking each photo. You can also click and drag your mouse over the photos. Click the File menu. This option is in the upper left corner of the window. Click Print. This option appears in the drop-down menu after you click File. This opens up a print preview screen that shows you the images you chose to print. Click the Contact Sheet option. It's on the right side of the print menu. Click Print. Your selected photos are printed onto a single piece of paper. You may have to select your printer's name from the "Printer" drop-down menu first.
